ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Improved microscopy skills, pipetting, following protocols, scientific writing, data display, proper lab documentation and familiarity with benchwork. Learned about a lot of different techniques and organisms found in laboratory settings.

I learned a lot of techniques in biology lab. I learned how to document efficiently in a lab notebook. I learned how to follow instructions and converse with classmates efficiently about what we are supposed to be doing.
I learned about model organisms which was very interesting
Intro biological lab techniques and some complex concepts
Biological research methods
I learned many new biological techniques
I gained knowledge of fundamental lab techniques and writing skills, especially related to preparing lab notebooks and lab reports.
You learn how to think on your feet in a lab setting. She often will change the procedure during the lab and you have to learn how to adjust.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class is very structured with packets that provide plenty of information on techniques and organisms you're working on. Directions for lab reports are clear. While some experiments take time and require focus, the classroom atmosphere is relaxed enough to let people learn. We received comments on all graded assignments stating why points were taken off. Moreno looks for overall improvement throughout the course, which is nice especially for those without prior lab experience. She is also understanding about due dates as long as students communicate with her. There is a fair amount of writing, but considering it counts as half a writing credit, that makes sense. Only weakness for the course is sitting still for 4 hours once a week and only getting half a credit.

This course was extremely unorganized and I wanted to cry almost every single class because I was so confused. I think a major weakness was the lack of instruction or help from the TF's. There were not a whole lot of strengths, if any.

Strengths-- the activities during lab are very interesting and engaging. I liked that it was very collaborative work.
Weaknesses-- there is a ton of writing (which is why it gets a writing designation, but only a half, so it isn't very helpful) and the reports take MANY hours to complete. Additionally, it is a lab course, so it is only 0.5 credits even though the class lasts for 4 hours (sometimes longer).

Strengths: The TAs are exceptional. My TA always took time to answer my questions and respond to my emails and seemed genuinely excited about the course. Dr Moreno is wonderful and cares about her students. She also set up the course to be very collaborative with a focus on student learning, regardless of current biology background. 

Weaknesses: I sometimes didn't understand the concepts because I had yet to learn them in intro bio. The first lab report was also very very long (double the workload of any other lab report) which was jarring.

Although there was a lot of scientific writing involved and harsh grading along with it, I'm not sure I really gained any skills in scientific writing. Grading of lab reports seemed unnecessarily harsh. Conducting lab experiments was interesting, and I could tell the teaching team put a lot of effort into preparing.
I thought the course was very good but it would have been nice to receive a little bit more feedback.
It's a pretty easy lab credit with an interesting syllabus.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're in MCDB this is a great way to work on your writing credits and fill the MCDB lab requirements. Even with prior lab experience, this was a fun course. I know it's not required for the Bio sequence, but taking them with bio 101 and 102 really helped reinforce some of the concepts.
No
Yes! This course is one of the most enjoyable labs at Yale. This course helped me determine my trajectory as a scientist.
Only for those very passionate about research. Not for those looking for a fun lab course or to fulfill a requirement.
Yes I learned a lot about model organisms for biological research
I would recommend this class to anyone who would like to gain essential bio lab skills.
Yes. It's a pretty easy lab credit and the labs are fun.
